oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a detail of a French painting, the English River, a drawing of a church, people at a Canadian park, a dancer, a barge, and two ads. Nashville Banner, 1927 July 10.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Armour, Peggy; Morrison, Lew; Depew, Helen
Nashville Banner
Paintings; Landscapes (Representations); Churches; Parks; Barges; Dancers
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Cumberland River (Ky. and Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a section from a French painting (the Pantheon de la Guerre, the then-largest painting in the world), a view of the English River, a drawing of the Southern Presbyterian church in Washington, D. C., people at the Jasper National Park in Canada, a ballet dancer from Lawrenceburg, Tennessee, a steel barge launching into the Cumberland River, and two ads. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Herbert
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
